properties.name: touch
properties.description: `true`, when running in a touch device.

properties.name: wide
properties.description: `true`, when running in a tablet/desktop device.

attributes.name: touch
attributes.description: `true`, when running in a touch device.

attributes.name: wide
attributes.description: `true`, when running in a tablet/desktop device.

elements.description:
The overlay element.

### Styling

See [`<vaadin-overlay>` documentation](https://github.com/vaadin/vaadin-overlay/blob/master/src/vaadin-overlay.html)
for `<vaadin-context-menu-overlay>` parts.

See [ThemableMixin – how to apply styles for shadow parts](https://github.com/vaadin/vaadin-themable-mixin/wiki)

properties.name: modeless
properties.description:
When true the overlay won't disable the main content, showing
it doesn’t change the functionality of the user interface.

properties.name: focusTrap
properties.description:
When true move focus to the first focusable element in the overlay,
or to the overlay if there are no focusable elements.

methods.name: _outsideClickListener
methods.description:
We need to listen on 'click' / 'tap' event and capture it and close the overlay before
propagating the event to the listener in the button. Otherwise, if the clicked button would call
open(), this would happen: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z86V_ICUCD4

elements.name: Vaadin.ContextMenuOverlayElement

attributes.name: modeless
attributes.description:
When true the overlay won't disable the main content, showing
it doesn’t change the functionality of the user interface.

attributes.name: focus-trap
attributes.description:
When true move focus to the first focusable element in the overlay,
or to the overlay if there are no focusable elements.

events.name: vaadin-overlay-close
events.description:
vaadin-overlay-close
fired before the `vaadin-overlay` will be closed. If canceled the closing of the overlay is canceled as well.

events.name: vaadin-overlay-escape-press
events.description:
vaadin-overlay-escape-press
fired before the `vaadin-overlay` will be closed on ESC button press. If canceled the closing of the overlay is canceled as well.

events.name: vaadin-overlay-open
events.description:
vaadin-overlay-open
fired after the `vaadin-overlay` is opened.

events.name: vaadin-overlay-outside-click
events.description:
vaadin-overlay-outside-click
fired before the `vaadin-overlay` will be closed on outside click. If canceled the closing of the overlay is canceled as well.

elements.description:
```html ``` ### “vaadin-contextmenu” Gesture Event `vaadin-contextmenu` is a gesture event (a custom event fired by Polymer), which is dispatched after either `contextmenu` and long touch events. This enables support for both mouse and touch environments in a uniform way. `` opens the menu overlay on the `vaadin-contextmenu` event by default. ### Menu Listener By default, the `` element listens for the menu opening event on itself. In order to have a context menu on your content, wrap your content with the `` element, and add a template element with a menu. Example: ```html

This paragraph has the context menu provided in the above template.

Another paragraph with the context menu.

 ``` In case if you do not want to wrap the page content, you can listen for events on an element outside the `` by setting the `listenOn` property: ```html
The element that listens for the context menu.
<script> const contextMenu = document.querySelector('vaadin-context-menu#customListener'); contextMenu.listenOn = document.querySelector('#menuListener'); </script> ``` ### Filtering Menu Targets By default, the listener element and all its descendants open the context menu. You can filter the menu targets to a smaller set of elements inside the listener element by setting the `selector` property. In the following example, only the elements matching `.has-menu` will open the context menu: ```html

This paragraph opens the context menu

This paragraph does not open the context menu

 ``` ### Menu Context You can bind to the following properties in the menu template: - `target` is the menu opening event target, which is the element that the user has called the context menu for - `detail` is the menu opening event detail In the following example, the menu item text is composed with the contents of the element that opened the menu: ```html
  • Foo
  • Bar
  • Baz
 ``` ### Styling See [ThemableMixin – how to apply styles for shadow parts](https://github.com/vaadin/vaadin-themable-mixin/wiki)

properties.name: selector
properties.description:
CSS selector that can be used to target any child element
of the context menu to listen for `openOn` events.

properties.name: opened
properties.description: True if the overlay is currently displayed.

properties.name: openOn
properties.description: Event name to listen for opening the context menu.

properties.name: listenOn
properties.description:
The target element that's listened to for context menu opening events.
By default the vaadin-context-menu listens to the target's `vaadin-contextmenu`
events.

properties.name: closeOn
properties.description: Event name to listen for closing the context menu.

methods.name: _addEventListenerToNode
methods.description: Add the event listener to the node if it is a gestures event.

params.name: node
params.description: Node to add event listener to

methods.name: _removeEventListenerFromNode
methods.description: Remove the event listener to the node if it is a gestures event.

params.name: node
params.description: Node to remove event listener from

methods.name: close
methods.description: Closes the overlay.

methods.name: open
methods.description: Opens the overlay.

params.name: e
params.description: used as the context for the menu. Overlay coordinates are taken from this event.

elements.name: Vaadin.ContextMenuElement

attributes.name: selector
attributes.description:
CSS selector that can be used to target any child element
of the context menu to listen for `openOn` events.

attributes.name: opened
attributes.description: True if the overlay is currently displayed.

attributes.name: open-on
attributes.description: Event name to listen for opening the context menu.

attributes.name: listen-on
attributes.description:
The target element that's listened to for context menu opening events.
By default the vaadin-context-menu listens to the target's `vaadin-contextmenu`
events.

attributes.name: close-on
attributes.description: Event name to listen for closing the context menu.

methods.name: _stampTemplate
methods.description:
Stamps the provided template and performs instance-time setup for
Polymer template features, including data bindings, declarative event
listeners, and the `this.$` map of `id`'s to nodes.  A document fragment
is returned containing the stamped DOM, ready for insertion into the
DOM.

This method may be called more than once; however note that due to
`shadycss` polyfill limitations, only styles from templates prepared
using `ShadyCSS.prepareTemplate` will be correctly polyfilled (scoped
to the shadow root and support CSS custom properties), and note that
`ShadyCSS.prepareTemplate` may only be called once per element. As such,
any styles required by in runtime-stamped templates must be included
in the main element template.

return.desc: Cloned template content

methods.name: _addMethodEventListenerToNode
methods.description:
Adds an event listener by method name for the event provided.

This method generates a handler function that looks up the method
name at handling time.

params.name: context
params.description:
Context the method will be called on (defaults
  to `node`)

return.desc: Generated handler function

methods.name: _addEventListenerToNode
methods.description: Override point for adding custom or simulated event handling.

params.name: node
params.description: Node to add event listener to

methods.name: _removeEventListenerFromNode
methods.description: Override point for adding custom or simulated event handling.

params.name: node
params.description: Node to remove event listener from

methods.name: _createPropertyAccessor
methods.description:
Creates a setter/getter pair for the named property with its own
local storage.  The getter returns the value in the local storage,
and the setter calls `_setProperty`, which updates the local storage
for the property and enqueues a `_propertiesChanged` callback.

This method may be called on a prototype or an instance.  Calling
this method may overwrite a property value that already exists on
the prototype/instance by creating the accessor.

params.name: readOnly
params.description:
When true, no setter is created; the
  protected `_setProperty` function must be used to set the property

methods.name: _addPropertyToAttributeMap
methods.description:
Adds the given `property` to a map matching attribute names
to property names, using `attributeNameForProperty`. This map is
used when deserializing attribute values to properties.

methods.name: _definePropertyAccessor
methods.description: Defines a property accessor for the given property.

params.name: readOnly
params.description: When true, no setter is created

methods.name: ready
methods.description: Stamps the element template.

methods.name: _initializeProperties
methods.description:
Overrides the default `Polymer.PropertyAccessors` to ensure class
metaprogramming related to property accessors and effects has
completed (calls `finalize`).

It also initializes any property defaults provided via `value` in
`properties` metadata.

methods.name: _initializeInstanceProperties
methods.description:
Called at ready time with bag of instance properties that overwrote
accessors when the element upgraded.

The default implementation sets these properties back into the
setter at ready time.  This method is provided as an override
point for customizing or providing more efficient initialization.

params.name: props
params.description:
Bag of property values that were overwritten
  when creating property accessors.

methods.name: _setProperty
methods.description:
Updates the local storage for a property (via `_setPendingProperty`)
and enqueues a `_proeprtiesChanged` callback.

methods.name: _getProperty
methods.description: Returns the value for the given property.

return.desc: Value for the given property

methods.name: _setPendingProperty
methods.description:
Updates the local storage for a property, records the previous value,
and adds it to the set of "pending changes" that will be passed to the
`_propertiesChanged` callback.  This method does not enqueue the
`_propertiesChanged` callback.

params.name: ext
params.description: Not used here; affordance for closure

return.desc: Returns true if the property changed

methods.name: _invalidateProperties
methods.description:
Marks the properties as invalid, and enqueues an async
`_propertiesChanged` callback.

methods.name: _enableProperties
methods.description:
Call to enable property accessor processing. Before this method is
called accessor values will be set but side effects are
queued. When called, any pending side effects occur immediately.
For elements, generally `connectedCallback` is a normal spot to do so.
It is safe to call this method multiple times as it only turns on
property accessors once.

methods.name: _flushProperties
methods.description:
Calls the `_propertiesChanged` callback with the current set of
pending changes (and old values recorded when pending changes were
set), and resets the pending set of changes. Generally, this method
should not be called in user code.

methods.name: _propertiesChanged
methods.description:
Callback called when any properties with accessors created via
`_createPropertyAccessor` have been set.

params.name: currentProps
params.description: Bag of all current accessor values

params.name: changedProps
params.description:
Bag of properties changed since the last
  call to `_propertiesChanged`

params.name: oldProps
params.description:
Bag of previous values for each property
  in `changedProps`

methods.name: _shouldPropertyChange
methods.description:
Method called to determine whether a property value should be
considered as a change and cause the `_propertiesChanged` callback
to be enqueued.

The default implementation returns `true` if a strict equality
check fails. The method always returns false for `NaN`.

Override this method to e.g. provide stricter checking for
Objects/Arrays when using immutable patterns.

return.desc:
Whether the property should be considered a change
  and enqueue a `_proeprtiesChanged` callback

methods.name: attributeChangedCallback
methods.description:
Implements native Custom Elements `attributeChangedCallback` to
set an attribute value to a property via `_attributeToProperty`.

methods.name: _attributeToProperty
methods.description:
Deserializes an attribute to its associated property.

This method calls the `_deserializeValue` method to convert the string to
a typed value.

params.name: type
params.description:
type to deserialize to, defaults to the value
returned from `typeForProperty`

methods.name: _propertyToAttribute
methods.description: Serializes a property to its associated attribute.

methods.name: _valueToNodeAttribute
methods.description:
Sets a typed value to an HTML attribute on a node.

This method calls the `_serializeValue` method to convert the typed
value to a string.  If the `_serializeValue` method returns `undefined`,
the attribute will be removed (this is the default for boolean
type `false`).

methods.name: _serializeValue
methods.description:
Converts a typed JavaScript value to a string.

This method is called when setting JS property values to
HTML attributes.  Users may override this method to provide
serialization for custom types.

return.desc:
String serialized from the provided
property  value.

methods.name: _deserializeValue
methods.description:
Converts a string to a typed JavaScript value.

This method is called when reading HTML attribute values to
JS properties.  Users may override this method to provide
deserialization for custom `type`s. Types for `Boolean`, `String`,
and `Number` convert attributes to the expected types.

params.name: type
params.description: Type to deserialize the string to.

return.desc: Typed value deserialized from the provided string.

methods.name: _initializeProtoProperties
methods.description:
Overrides `Polymer.PropertyAccessors` implementation to provide a
more efficient implementation of initializing properties from
the prototype on the instance.

params.name: props
params.description: Properties to initialize on the prototype

methods.name: _ensureAttribute
methods.description:
Ensures the element has the given attribute. If it does not,
assigns the given value to the attribute.

params.name: attribute
params.description: Name of attribute to ensure is set.

methods.name: _hasAccessor
methods.description: Returns true if this library created an accessor for the given property.

return.desc: True if an accessor was created

methods.name: _isPropertyPending
methods.description: Returns true if the specified property has a pending change.

return.desc: True if property has a pending change

methods.name: _addPropertyEffect
methods.description:
Equivalent to static `addPropertyEffect` API but can be called on
an instance to add effects at runtime.  See that method for
full API docs.

params.name: property
params.description: Property that should trigger the effect

methods.name: _removePropertyEffect
methods.description: Removes the given property effect.

params.name: property
params.description: Property the effect was associated with

methods.name: _hasPropertyEffect
methods.description:
Returns whether the current prototype/instance has a property effect
of a certain type.

return.desc: True if the prototype/instance has an effect of this type

methods.name: _hasReadOnlyEffect
methods.description:
Returns whether the current prototype/instance has a "read only"
accessor for the given property.

return.desc: True if the prototype/instance has an effect of this type

methods.name: _hasNotifyEffect
methods.description:
Returns whether the current prototype/instance has a "notify"
property effect for the given property.

return.desc: True if the prototype/instance has an effect of this type

methods.name: _hasReflectEffect
methods.description:
Returns whether the current prototype/instance has a "reflect to attribute"
property effect for the given property.

return.desc: True if the prototype/instance has an effect of this type

methods.name: _hasComputedEffect
methods.description:
Returns whether the current prototype/instance has a "computed"
property effect for the given property.

return.desc: True if the prototype/instance has an effect of this type

methods.name: _setPendingPropertyOrPath
methods.description:
Sets a pending property or path.  If the root property of the path in
question had no accessor, the path is set, otherwise it is enqueued
via `_setPendingProperty`.

This function isolates relatively expensive functionality necessary
for the public API (`set`, `setProperties`, `notifyPath`, and property
change listeners via {{...}} bindings), such that it is only done
when paths enter the system, and not at every propagation step.  It
also sets a `__dataHasPaths` flag on the instance which is used to
fast-path slower path-matching code in the property effects host paths.

`path` can be a path string or array of path parts as accepted by the
public API.

params.name: shouldNotify
params.description:
Set to true if this change should
 cause a property notification event dispatch

params.name: isPathNotification
params.description:
If the path being set is a path
  notification of an already changed value, as opposed to a request
  to set and notify the change.  In the latter `false` case, a dirty
  check is performed and then the value is set to the path before
  enqueuing the pending property change.

return.desc:
Returns true if the property/path was enqueued in
  the pending changes bag.

methods.name: _setUnmanagedPropertyToNode
methods.description:
Applies a value to a non-Polymer element/node's property.

The implementation makes a best-effort at binding interop:
Some native element properties have side-effects when
re-setting the same value (e.g. setting `<input>.value` resets the
cursor position), so we do a dirty-check before setting the value.
However, for better interop with non-Polymer custom elements that
accept objects, we explicitly re-set object changes coming from the
Polymer world (which may include deep object changes without the
top reference changing), erring on the side of providing more
information.

Users may override this method to provide alternate approaches.

params.name: node
params.description: The node to set a property on

methods.name: _enqueueClient
methods.description:
Enqueues the given client on a list of pending clients, whose
pending property changes can later be flushed via a call to
`_flushClients`.

methods.name: _flushClients
methods.description:
Flushes any clients previously enqueued via `_enqueueClient`, causing
their `_flushProperties` method to run.

methods.name: __enableOrFlushClients
methods.description: (c) the stamped dom enables.

methods.name: _readyClients
methods.description:
Implements `PropertyEffects`'s `_readyClients` call. Attaches
element dom by calling `_attachDom` with the dom stamped from the
element's template via `_stampTemplate`. Note that this allows
client dom to be attached to the element prior to any observers
running.

methods.name: setProperties
methods.description:
Sets a bag of property changes to this instance, and
synchronously processes all effects of the properties as a batch.

Property names must be simple properties, not paths.  Batched
path propagation is not supported.

params.name: props
params.description:
Bag of one or more key-value pairs whose key is
  a property and value is the new value to set for that property.

params.name: setReadOnly
params.description:
When true, any private values set in
  `props` will be set. By default, `setProperties` will not set
  `readOnly: true` root properties.

methods.name: _propagatePropertyChanges
methods.description:
Called to propagate any property changes to stamped template nodes
managed by this element.

params.name: oldProps
params.description: Bag of previous values for changed properties

params.name: hasPaths
params.description: True with `props` contains one or more paths

methods.name: linkPaths
methods.description:
Aliases one data path as another, such that path notifications from one
are routed to the other.

methods.name: unlinkPaths
methods.description:
Removes a data path alias previously established with `_linkPaths`.

Note, the path to unlink should be the target (`to`) used when
linking the paths.

methods.name: notifySplices

params.name: splices
params.description:
Array of splice records indicating ordered
  changes that occurred to the array. Each record should have the
  following fields:
   * index: index at which the change occurred
   * removed: array of items that were removed from this index
   * addedCount: number of new items added at this index
   * object: a reference to the array in question
   * type: the string literal 'splice'

  Note that splice records _must_ be normalized such that they are
  reported in index order (raw results from `Object.observe` are not
  ordered and must be normalized/merged before notifying).

methods.name: get
methods.description:
Convenience method for reading a value from a path.

Note, if any part in the path is undefined, this method returns
`undefined` (this method does not throw when dereferencing undefined
paths).

params.name: path
params.description:
Path to the value
  to read.  The path may be specified as a string (e.g. `foo.bar.baz`)
  or an array of path parts (e.g. `['foo.bar', 'baz']`).  Note that
  bracketed expressions are not supported; string-based path parts
  *must* be separated by dots.  Note that when dereferencing array
  indices, the index may be used as a dotted part directly
  (e.g. `users.12.name` or `['users', 12, 'name']`).

params.name: root
params.description: Root object from which the path is evaluated.

return.desc:
Value at the path, or `undefined` if any part of the path
  is undefined.

methods.name: set
methods.description:
Convenience method for setting a value to a path and notifying any
elements bound to the same path.

Note, if any part in the path except for the last is undefined,
this method does nothing (this method does not throw when
dereferencing undefined paths).

params.name: path
params.description:
Path to the value
  to write.  The path may be specified as a string (e.g. `'foo.bar.baz'`)
  or an array of path parts (e.g. `['foo.bar', 'baz']`).  Note that
  bracketed expressions are not supported; string-based path parts
  *must* be separated by dots.  Note that when dereferencing array
  indices, the index may be used as a dotted part directly
  (e.g. `'users.12.name'` or `['users', 12, 'name']`).

params.name: value
params.description: Value to set at the specified path.

params.name: root
params.description:
Root object from which the path is evaluated.
  When specified, no notification will occur.

methods.name: push
methods.description:
Adds items onto the end of the array at the path specified.

The arguments after `path` and return value match that of
`Array.prototype.push`.

This method notifies other paths to the same array that a
splice occurred to the array.

return.desc: New length of the array.

methods.name: pop
methods.description:
Removes an item from the end of array at the path specified.

The arguments after `path` and return value match that of
`Array.prototype.pop`.

This method notifies other paths to the same array that a
splice occurred to the array.

return.desc: Item that was removed.

methods.name: splice
methods.description:
Starting from the start index specified, removes 0 or more items
from the array and inserts 0 or more new items in their place.

The arguments after `path` and return value match that of
`Array.prototype.splice`.

This method notifies other paths to the same array that a
splice occurred to the array.

params.name: start
params.description: Index from which to start removing/inserting.

return.desc: Array of removed items.

methods.name: shift
methods.description:
Removes an item from the beginning of array at the path specified.

The arguments after `path` and return value match that of
`Array.prototype.pop`.

This method notifies other paths to the same array that a
splice occurred to the array.

return.desc: Item that was removed.

methods.name: unshift
methods.description:
Adds items onto the beginning of the array at the path specified.

The arguments after `path` and return value match that of
`Array.prototype.push`.

This method notifies other paths to the same array that a
splice occurred to the array.

return.desc: New length of the array.

methods.name: notifyPath
_createReadOnlyProperty
methods.description:
Equivalent to static `createReadOnlyProperty` API but can be called on
an instance to add effects at runtime.  See that method for
full API docs.

params.name: protectedSetter
params.description:
Creates a custom protected setter
  when `true`.

methods.name: _createPropertyObserver
methods.description:
Equivalent to static `createPropertyObserver` API but can be called on
an instance to add effects at runtime.  See that method for
full API docs.

params.name: method
params.description: Function or name of observer method to call

params.name: dynamicFn
params.description:
Whether the method name should be included as
  a dependency to the effect.

methods.name: _createMethodObserver
methods.description:
Equivalent to static `createMethodObserver` API but can be called on
an instance to add effects at runtime.  See that method for
full API docs.

params.name: dynamicFn
params.description:
Boolean or object map indicating
  whether method names should be included as a dependency to the effect.

methods.name: _createNotifyingProperty
methods.description:
Equivalent to static `createNotifyingProperty` API but can be called on
an instance to add effects at runtime.  See that method for
full API docs.

methods.name: _createReflectedProperty
methods.description:
Equivalent to static `createReflectedProperty` API but can be called on
an instance to add effects at runtime.  See that method for
full API docs.

methods.name: _createComputedProperty
methods.description:
Equivalent to static `createComputedProperty` API but can be called on
an instance to add effects at runtime.  See that method for
full API docs.

params.name: property
params.description: Name of computed property to set

params.name: dynamicFn
params.description:
Boolean or object map indicating
  whether method names should be included as a dependency to the effect.

methods.name: _bindTemplate
methods.description:
Equivalent to static `bindTemplate` API but can be called on
an instance to add effects at runtime.  See that method for
full API docs.

This method may be called on the prototype (for prototypical template
binding, to avoid creating accessors every instance) once per prototype,
and will be called with `runtimeBinding: true` by `_stampTemplate` to
create and link an instance of the template metadata associated with a
particular stamping.

params.name: instanceBinding
params.description:
When false (default), performs
  "prototypical" binding of the template and overwrites any previously
  bound template for the class. When true (as passed from
  `_stampTemplate`), the template info is instanced and linked into
  the list of bound templates.

return.desc:
Template metadata object; for `runtimeBinding`,
  this is an instance of the prototypical template info

methods.name: _removeBoundDom
methods.description:
Removes and unbinds the nodes previously contained in the provided
DocumentFragment returned from `_stampTemplate`.

params.name: dom
params.description:
DocumentFragment previously returned
  from `_stampTemplate` associated with the nodes to be removed

methods.name: connectedCallback
methods.description:
Provides a default implementation of the standard Custom Elements
`connectedCallback`.

The default implementation enables the property effects system and
flushes any pending properties, and updates shimmed CSS properties
when using the ShadyCSS scoping/custom properties polyfill.

methods.name: disconnectedCallback
methods.description: Called when the element is removed from a document

methods.name: _attachDom
methods.description:
Attaches an element's stamped dom to itself. By default,
this method creates a `shadowRoot` and adds the dom to it.
However, this method may be overridden to allow an element
to put its dom in another location.

return.desc: node to which the dom has been attached.

methods.name: updateStyles
methods.description:
When using the ShadyCSS scoping and custom property shim, causes all
shimmed styles in this element (and its subtree) to be updated
based on current custom property values.

The optional parameter overrides inline custom property styles with an
object of properties where the keys are CSS properties, and the values
are strings.

Example: `this.updateStyles({'--color': 'blue'})`

These properties are retained unless a value of `null` is set.

params.name: properties
params.description:
Bag of custom property key/values to
  apply to this element.

methods.name: resolveUrl
methods.description:
Rewrites a given URL relative to a base URL. The base URL defaults to
the original location of the document containing the `dom-module` for
this element. This method will return the same URL before and after
bundling.

Note that this function performs no resolution for URLs that start
with `/` (absolute URLs) or `#` (hash identifiers).  For general purpose
URL resolution, use `window.URL`.

params.name: base
params.description:
Optional base URL to resolve against, defaults
to the element's `importPath`

return.desc: Rewritten URL relative to base

staticMethods.name: _parseTemplate

params.name: outerTemplateInfo
params.description:
Template metadata from the outer
  template, for parsing nested templates

return.desc: Parsed template metadata

staticMethods.name: _parseTemplateContent
staticMethods.description:
Overrides `PropertyAccessors` to add map of dynamic functions on
template info, for consumption by `PropertyEffects` template binding
code. This map determines which method templates should have accessors
created for them.

staticMethods.name: _parseTemplateNode
staticMethods.description:
Overrides default `TemplateStamp` implementation to add support for
parsing bindings from `TextNode`'s' `textContent`.  A `bindings`
array is added to `nodeInfo` and populated with binding metadata
with information capturing the binding target, and a `parts` array
with one or more metadata objects capturing the source(s) of the
binding.

params.name: nodeInfo
params.description: Node metadata for current template node

return.desc:
`true` if the visited node added node-specific
  metadata to `nodeInfo`

staticMethods.name: _parseTemplateChildNodes
staticMethods.description:
Parses template child nodes for the given root node.

This method also wraps whitelisted legacy template extensions
(`is="dom-if"` and `is="dom-repeat"`) with their equivalent element
wrappers, collapses text nodes, and strips whitespace from the template
if the `templateInfo.stripWhitespace` setting was provided.

params.name: root
params.description: Root node whose `childNodes` will be parsed

staticMethods.name: _parseTemplateNestedTemplate
staticMethods.description:
Overrides default `TemplateStamp` implementation to add support for
binding the properties that a nested template depends on to the template
as `_host_<property>`.

params.name: nodeInfo
params.description: Node metadata for current template node

return.desc:
`true` if the visited node added node-specific
  metadata to `nodeInfo`

staticMethods.name: _parseTemplateNodeAttributes
staticMethods.description:
Parses template node attributes and adds node metadata to `nodeInfo`
for nodes of interest.

return.desc:
`true` if the visited node added node-specific
  metadata to `nodeInfo`

staticMethods.name: _parseTemplateNodeAttribute
staticMethods.description:
Overrides default `TemplateStamp` implementation to add support for
parsing bindings from attributes.  A `bindings`
array is added to `nodeInfo` and populated with binding metadata
with information capturing the binding target, and a `parts` array
with one or more metadata objects capturing the source(s) of the
binding.

params.name: nodeInfo
params.description: Node metadata for current template node

return.desc:
`true` if the visited node added node-specific
  metadata to `nodeInfo`

staticMethods.name: _contentForTemplate
staticMethods.description:
Returns the `content` document fragment for a given template.

For nested templates, Polymer performs an optimization to cache nested
template content to avoid the cost of cloning deeply nested templates.
This method retrieves the cached content for a given template.

return.desc: Content fragment

staticMethods.name: createProperties
staticMethods.description:
Override of PropertiesChanged createProperties to create accessors
and property effects for all of the properties.

staticMethods.name: attributeNameForProperty
staticMethods.description:
Returns an attribute name that corresponds to the given property.
The attribute name is the lowercased property name. Override to
customize this mapping.

return.desc: Attribute name corresponding to the given property.

staticMethods.name: typeForProperty
staticMethods.description:
Overrides `PropertiesChanged` method to return type specified in the
static `properties` object for the given property.

return.desc: Type to which to deserialize attribute

staticMethods.name: createPropertiesForAttributes
staticMethods.description:
Generates property accessors for all attributes in the standard
static `observedAttributes` array.

Attribute names are mapped to property names using the `dash-case` to
`camelCase` convention

staticMethods.name: addPropertyEffect
staticMethods.description:
Ensures an accessor exists for the specified property, and adds
to a list of "property effects" that will run when the accessor for
the specified property is set.  Effects are grouped by "type", which
roughly corresponds to a phase in effect processing.  The effect
metadata should be in the following form:

    {
      fn: effectFunction, // Reference to function to call to perform effect
      info: { ... }       // Effect metadata passed to function
      trigger: {          // Optional triggering metadata; if not provided
        name: string      // the property is treated as a wildcard
        structured: boolean
        wildcard: boolean
      }
    }

Effects are called from `_propertiesChanged` in the following order by
type:

1. COMPUTE
2. PROPAGATE
3. REFLECT
4. OBSERVE
5. NOTIFY

Effect functions are called with the following signature:

    effectFunction(inst, path, props, oldProps, info, hasPaths)

params.name: property
params.description: Property that should trigger the effect

staticMethods.name: createPropertyObserver
staticMethods.description: Creates a single-property observer for the given property.

params.name: method
params.description: Function or name of observer method to call

params.name: dynamicFn
params.description:
Whether the method name should be included as
  a dependency to the effect.

staticMethods.name: createMethodObserver
staticMethods.description:
Creates a multi-property "method observer" based on the provided
expression, which should be a string in the form of a normal JavaScript
function signature: `'methodName(arg1, [..., argn])'`.  Each argument
should correspond to a property or path in the context of this
prototype (or instance), or may be a literal string or number.

return.desc: whether method names should be included as a dependency to the effect.

staticMethods.name: createNotifyingProperty
staticMethods.description:
Causes the setter for the given property to dispatch `<property>-changed`
events to notify of changes to the property.

staticMethods.name: createReadOnlyProperty
staticMethods.description:
Creates a read-only accessor for the given property.

To set the property, use the protected `_setProperty` API.
To create a custom protected setter (e.g. `_setMyProp()` for
property `myProp`), pass `true` for `protectedSetter`.

Note, if the property will have other property effects, this method
should be called first, before adding other effects.

params.name: protectedSetter
params.description:
Creates a custom protected setter
  when `true`.

staticMethods.name: createReflectedProperty
staticMethods.description:
Causes the setter for the given property to reflect the property value
to a (dash-cased) attribute of the same name.

staticMethods.name: createComputedProperty
staticMethods.description:
Creates a computed property whose value is set to the result of the
method described by the given `expression` each time one or more
arguments to the method changes.  The expression should be a string
in the form of a normal JavaScript function signature:
`'methodName(arg1, [..., argn])'`

params.name: property
params.description: Name of computed property to set

params.name: dynamicFn
params.description:
Boolean or object map indicating whether
  method names should be included as a dependency to the effect.

staticMethods.name: bindTemplate
staticMethods.description:
Parses the provided template to ensure binding effects are created
for them, and then ensures property accessors are created for any
dependent properties in the template.  Binding effects for bound
templates are stored in a linked list on the instance so that
templates can be efficiently stamped and unstamped.

return.desc: Template metadata object

staticMethods.name: _addTemplatePropertyEffect
staticMethods.description:
Adds a property effect to the given template metadata, which is run
at the "propagate" stage of `_propertiesChanged` when the template
has been bound to the element via `_bindTemplate`.

The `effect` object should match the format in `_addPropertyEffect`.

params.name: templateInfo
params.description: Template metadata to add effect to

params.name: prop
params.description: Property that should trigger the effect

staticMethods.name: _parseBindings
staticMethods.description:
Called to parse text in a template (either attribute values or
textContent) into binding metadata.

Any overrides of this method should return an array of binding part
metadata  representing one or more bindings found in the provided text
and any "literal" text in between.  Any non-literal parts will be passed
to `_evaluateBinding` when any dependencies change.  The only required
fields of each "part" in the returned array are as follows:

- `dependencies` - Array containing trigger metadata for each property
  that should trigger the binding to update
- `literal` - String containing text if the part represents a literal;
  in this case no `dependencies` are needed

Additional metadata for use by `_evaluateBinding` may be provided in
each part object as needed.

The default implementation handles the following types of bindings
(one or more may be intermixed with literal strings):
- Property binding: `[[prop]]`
- Path binding: `[[object.prop]]`
- Negated property or path bindings: `[[!prop]]` or `[[!object.prop]]`
- Two-way property or path bindings (supports negation):
  `{{prop}}`, `{{object.prop}}`, `{{!prop}}` or `{{!object.prop}}`
- Inline computed method (supports negation):
  `[[compute(a, 'literal', b)]]`, `[[!compute(a, 'literal', b)]]`

params.name: text
params.description: Text to parse from attribute or textContent

return.desc: Array of binding part metadata

staticMethods.name: _evaluateBinding
staticMethods.description:
Called to evaluate a previously parsed binding part based on a set of
one or more changed dependencies.

params.name: inst
params.description:
Element that should be used as scope for
  binding dependencies

params.name: oldProps
params.description: Bag of previous values for changed properties

params.name: hasPaths
params.description: True with `props` contains one or more paths

return.desc: Value the binding part evaluated to

staticMethods.name: finalize
staticMethods.description:
Finalizes an element definition, including ensuring any super classes
are also finalized. This includes ensuring property
accessors exist on the element prototype. This method calls
`_finalizeClass` to finalize each constructor in the prototype chain.

staticMethods.name: _finalizeClass
staticMethods.description:
Override of PropertiesMixin _finalizeClass to create observers and
find the template.

staticMethods.name: createObservers
staticMethods.description:
Creates observers for the given `observers` array.
Leverages `PropertyEffects` to create observers.

params.name: observers
params.description:
Array of observer descriptors for
  this class

params.name: dynamicFns
params.description:
Object containing keys for any properties
  that are functions and should trigger the effect when the function
  reference is changed

staticMethods.name: _processStyleText
staticMethods.description: Gather style text for a style element in the template.

params.name: baseURI
params.description: Base URI to rebase CSS paths against

return.desc: The processed CSS text

staticMethods.name: _finalizeTemplate
staticMethods.description:
Configures an element `proto` to function with a given `template`.
The element name `is` and extends `ext` must be specified for ShadyCSS
style scoping.

params.name: is
params.description: Tag name (or type extension name) for this element
